componitorTemplate
directive in module componitor

Description

Registers a new html template directive with the given name. The componitor-template is automatically hidden from view by settings style="display:none;".

NOTE: Not a real directive. The contents of the <componitor-template /> elements are parsed in the .config method. I.e., the tags must be present when the angular application is bootstrapped.

For usage example see componitor

Usage

as element:
<componitor-template
       name="{String}">
</componitor-template>
as attribute
<ANY componitor-template
     name="{String}">
   ...
</ANY>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
nameString

an AngularJs-style camelCased representation of the created directive's name. Use two part names containing a dash to avoid future problems.
